channel.title: Clearing a variable
channel.description:
I'm making a powerminer but need a little help:
[code] FindObjArea(xt,yt,'Mine',1,1,518,339,rockycolour,2,true); Mouse(xt,yt,1,1,true); [/code]
All that does is look for the rock (and declares the position of the rock in the vars xt and yt, so the mouse can click on it)
And that script will keep repeating itself (it's a powerminer), but everytime it does it always clicks on the same position because 'xt' and 'yt' dont change. So I'm wondering if there's a way I can clear the variables. clearvar(xt); something like that... Or if anyone knows of any other was I could do this.
thanks in advance

item.title: Clearing a variable
item.description:
@1337 wrote:

Thank you very much , this looks like it should work, gonna try it out in a bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Clearing a variable
item.dc:creator: @yohojo yohojo
item.description:
@yohojo wrote:

You jusr just do something like this
Let the user put in thier own rock color and do:
[scar]X:=259
Y:=165
If Findcolorsprial(x,y,ROCKCOLOR,1,1,500,750) then
MMouse(x,y,2,2)
If IsUpText(‘Mine’) then
Mouse(x,y,00,true)[/scar]

Many people dont know waht u can put
[scar]X:=259
Y:=165[/scar]

What that does is decleare where the spiral starts from. Long ago i just did some simple math and found out that 259,165 is roughply the middle of the rs gamescreen. So basicaly this will search for the rock color. The search will start fomr the MIDDLE of the screen instead of from 1,1. It move the mouse to the color. Seee is it says “Mine” and then click.

Hope this helped,
yohojo

Read full topic

item.title: Clearing a variable
item.dc:creator: @Infintry001 Infintry001
item.description:
@Infintry001 wrote:

well, i think if there isnt that color in the xt yt spot, it will look for another one (at least, thats what happens with findcolortolerance)

Read full topic

item.title: Clearing a variable
item.description:
@1337 wrote:

I’m making a powerminer but need a little help:

     FindObjArea(xt,yt,'Mine',1,1,518,339,rockycolour,2,true);
     Mouse(xt,yt,1,1,true);

All that does is look for the rock (and declares the position of the rock in the vars xt and yt, so the mouse can click on it)

And that script will keep repeating itself (it’s a powerminer), but everytime it does it always clicks on the same position because ‘xt’ and ‘yt’ dont change. So I’m wondering if there’s a way I can clear the variables. clearvar(xt); something like that… Or if anyone knows of any other was I could do this.

thanks in advance
